image.altText: A crowd of young women looking worried and sad

props.synopsis: The Israeli military pulled off a complex operation to save four hostages, but even its own military knows not all of those being held by Hamas can be brought home this way.

title.children: Within hours of four hostages being freed, Israelis were protesting again and it's a problem for Netanyahu

image.altText: Gumbaynggirr and Yamatji singer Emma Donovan

props.synopsis: Award-winning Indigenous musician Emma Donovan will lodge a complaint with the taxi industry regulator after she says two cabs at Perth Airport refused to give her a ride "because of the colour of [her] skin".

title.children: 'They don't take my kind': Indigenous musician to lodge complaint after being refused taxi service

image.altText: Emmanuel Macron attends a campaign rally.

props.synopsis: French President Emmanuel Macron calls for new parliamentary elections after his camp heavily lost to the far-right National Rally party in the country's EU election.

title.children: Emmanuel Macron calls snap French election after far-right party makes gains

image.altText: A man wearing glasses stands next to a woman.

props.synopsis: The Greek coast guard moves the body of television doctor Michael Mosley, after it was found on the island of Symi, where the 67-year-old was holidaying with his wife.

title.children: Michael Mosley's wife comforted by 'outpouring' of love after tragic end to search for missing TV personality in Greece

image.altText: A close up of Dr Michael Mosley talking while leaning his head on his right hand.

props.synopsis: Dr Michael Mosley was a mainstay on British television and popularised a health trend that influenced millions around the world. But his journey to worldwide recognition started with a surprising diagnosis.

title.children: Michael Mosley thought he had melanoma. His actual diagnosis sparked a diet trend that swept the globe

image.altText: Kate White in collage with images of her electricity bill and a meter behind her.

props.synopsis: Estimates for gas and energy bills has been a common practice across Australia for years, but many people don't know to check.

title.children: Kate's 'very large' gas bill was more than halved when she asked one simple question

image.altText: Two men sit at a desk talking and looking at pages in front of them. Between them in the background are two Australian flags.

props.synopsis: This one-time Greens candidate, who is waging war on wind turbines, has found an unlikely ally – and a receptive audience – in Queensland's coal country.

title.children: He's the greenie fighting windfarms. In coal country he's found an unlikely ally

image.altText: ES_01227 copy

props.synopsis: From bullied schoolboy to Hollywood hopeful, this is how Quaden Bayles triumphed over the trolls and followed his dreams.

title.children: Mad Max actor Quaden Bayles is 'a whole different person' four years on from viral bullying video

image.altText: Eggs stamped with ID numbers in a carton

props.synopsis: Coles is limiting purchases to two cartons of eggs per customer after Agriculture Victoria confirmed a fifth property was infected.

title.children: Coles introduces egg limit across most states as bird flu continues to spread in Victoria

image.altText: Four people look on in disbelief at the remains of their home, which is now concrete rubble, following an airstrike

props.synopsis: Hamas has had its day of reckoning over the violent October 7 attacks, but Israel's day of reckoning for its eight-month-long response is still to come. The question is, has its response been proportional?

title.children: An Australian psychologist travelled to Gaza. What she saw were 'frozen' children

image.altText: A man walks up to a microphone in front of an Israeli flag.

props.synopsis: Benny Gantz has repeatedly clashed with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu over post-war plans for Gaza.

title.children: Israeli war minister Benny Gantz resigns from government, calls for elections

image.altText: Dan Andrews Aunty Beryl Van Oploo Hamish Blake composite

props.synopsis: A COVID-era premier, rocker and footy player have been recognised in this year's King's Birthday Honours list.

title.children: Footy player, rock star and former premiers recognised in King's Birthday Honours

image.altText: Black and white image group of people from the Pacific stare at camera from a QLD plantation. Their boss sits behind them.

props.synopsis: A prominent historian is reviving questions about the final resting place of up to 1,000 workers, fearing some remains could be located where a ward is set to be built at Mackay Base Hospital.

title.children: Fears hundreds of missing South Sea Islander bodies buried on hospital grounds

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Adam Bandt speak in the House of Representative.

props.synopsis: Politicians across the political divide believe we are at a crossroads — where militant political activity and rhetoric opposing the war in Gaza is coming dangerously close to sparking what could become real physical violence.

title.children: The war in Gaza has amplified the fault lines in our community and what politicians say in response matters

image.altText: People sunbathe under a row of umbrellas at a beach on Greece.

props.synopsis: Every winter a large cohort of Australians head north for the European summer. But with growing tourism hostility sweeping many visitor hotspots, they may not be getting such a warm welcome.

title.children: Are you a bad tourist? Aussies escaping to 'Euro summer' risk being part of a growing problem

image.altText: Ariarne Titmus pushes her goggles in

props.synopsis: Australia's swimmers face a do-or-die week in Brisbane to launch their Paris 2024 Olympic Games aspirations. Here's what you need to know.

title.children: One of the hottest fields in Aussie swimming history will fight for an Olympics spot this week — here's what you need to know

image.altText: A boy sits on a school bench holding a vape.

props.synopsis: The first national anti-vaping campaign won't revive graphic imagery of tar-filled lungs or people in their deathbeds, but raise a different fear.

title.children: 'Why are we still doing this?': Government launches nation-first anti-vaping campaign

image.altText: Carlos Alcaraz

props.synopsis: At just 21-years-old, Carlos Alcaraz claims his first French Open title and puts on a show of stunning shots to down German rival Alexander Zverev.

title.children: In a highlight reel of stunning shots, two incredible moments sum up the brilliance of Carlos Alcaraz's French Open win

image.altText: An Indian man is standing and speaking at a lectern. Next to him is a woman and two men in military uniform.

props.synopsis: In front of a cheering crowd, Narendra Modi is sworn in for an historic third-straight term. But with it comes a unique challenge for a man that has had an iron grip on Indian politics for a decade.

title.children: Sworn in for a third term, India's PM Narendra Modi faces a new challenge

image.altText: Max Verstappen in his Red Bull on track during the Canadian Grand Prix.

props.synopsis: Max Verstappen has survived a wet and wild race in Montréal, winning the Canadian Grand Prix and extending his lead in the Formula 1 world championship.

title.children: Max Verstappen wins dramatic race as Norris and Russell rue 'missed opportunity'

image.altText: Witiyana Marika dances during Yothu Yindi's set at Barunga Festival.

props.synopsis: Yothu Yindi leader Witiyana Marika says he will "keep on dancing" for a treaty as thousands gather at weekend to celebrate Indigenous culture at Barunga Festival.

title.children: 'I'm still waiting': Yothu Yindi leader reflects on campaign for Treaty at Barunga Festival

image.altText: fish fossil

props.synopsis: The ancient specimen, which is the length of a ute tray, has travelled more than 1,500 kilometres across Queensland to its home in the outback.

title.children: Jeppy the 100-million-year-old fish finally returning home after a decade

image.altText: Headshot of report author Petra Buchanan.

props.synopsis: Career dissatisfaction has reached a three-year high for women in media. But why? And how?

title.children: 'That is the definition of a mediocre man': Women in media paid worse than men, record high dissatisfaction

image.altText: A woman wearing a red blazer smiles, standing in front of an art piece with a red heart.

props.synopsis: Recovery from these surgeries can take six months, something the new technology hopes to alleviate with less invasive keyhole surgery.

title.children: Elle has had five open heart surgeries at the age of 41. She's hoping a new 'heart band-aid' may make the next one easier

image.altText: A woman smiles as she holds up bras on coathangers.

props.synopsis: For country women, buying a new bra isn't as easy as popping down to the shops; many women have never been professionally fitted. But a trailer full of bras trucked to the bush changed that.

title.children: 'I put on a bra and cried': Outback women experience life-changing bra fitting for the first time

image.altText: Caroline laying in a hospital bed

props.synopsis: Nearly 16 years ago, Caroline Southcott got up to go to the toilet on a flight from Singapore to Perth. As she was returning to her seat, she suffered severe injuries that continue to impact her to this day.

title.children: Caroline was a seasoned flyer who wore her seatbelt on long-haul flights. Then she got up to go to the bathroom

image.altText: Citipointe Christian College in Carindale's front sign

props.synopsis: Two years after causing outrage with a contract that singled out LGBTIQ+ students, Citipointe Christian College has issued a statement declaring its commitment to inclusivity.

title.children: Citipointe issues statement of regret two years after controversial student contract

image.altText: Margot and Polly standing on the street holding eachother

props.synopsis: Former Waverley councillor and lawyer Sam Einfeld was ordered to stay at a treatment facility awaiting sentencing over the assault of Margot Priday. Police now say they can't confirm his whereabouts.

title.children: 'Terrified' victims of ex-councillor say they have been kept in dark over alleged breach of bail

image.altText: Two women smiling at each other in a kitchen

props.synopsis: A free cooking program is teaching low-cost recipes as the City of Melbourne says 1 in 3 residents experience food insecurity.

title.children: A library in Melbourne is trading books for food to address cost pressures and social isolation

image.altText: Princess Kate smiles to the side in a red blazer

props.synopsis: The royal will miss the Trooping the Colour rehearsal, which is a 260-year-old tradition in which troops in full dress uniform parade past the king with their ceremonial flag.

title.children: Princess Kate apologises for missing rehearsal before King Charles's birthday

image.altText: Zac Williams kisses his wrist as he pays tribute to his late sister.

props.synopsis: Zac Williams pays tribute to his late sister Sam following his first goal in Carlton's 26-point triumph over Essendon at the MCG, while the ladder-leading Swans defeat Geelong in Sydney.

title.children: 'She'd be very proud': Zac Williams dedicates goal to his late sister in Blues' win over Bombers

image.altText: A teenage girl stands in front of a small plane in a hangar.

props.synopsis: Farmers and young people have flocked to the school amid a national decline in aviation training centres.

title.children: Flight school opens in remote part of WA, bucking national trend

image.altText: Two people wave in a front yard next to a leaning tower.

props.synopsis: In the biggest city on WA's southern coast, a scale replica of the Italian icon has brought joy to generations of locals and visitors.

title.children: This country town's replica Leaning Tower has brought joy to generations
